001/*

006
007package renderer.models_LP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a wireframe model of a sphere centered at the origin
015   by recursively subdividing the faces of a tetrahedron.
016<p>
017   Also use this subdivision process to draw Sierpinski triangles
018   on the surface of the sphere.
019*/
020public class SphereSubdivided extends Model implements MeshMaker
021{
022   final int n;
023
024   /**
025      Create a sphere centered at the origin by recursively
026      subdividing the faces of a tetrahedron four times.
027   */
028   public SphereSubdivided()
029   {
030      this(4);
031   }
032
033
034   /**
035      Create a sphere centered at the origin by recursively
036      subdividing the faces of a tetrahedron {@code n} times.
037
038      @param n  number of recursive subdivisions
039      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
040   */
041   public SphereSubdivided(final int n)
042   {
043      this(n, false, false);
044   }
045
046
047   /**
048      Create a sphere centered at the origin by recursively
049      subdividing the faces of a tetrahedron {@code n} times.
050   <p>
051      The {@code hole} parameter leaves out one of the original
052      four triangle faces of the tetrahedron. This creates a hole
053      in the final sphere that is useful for looking at the back
054      side of the sphere.
055   <p>
056      The {@code sierpinski} parameter creates Sierpinski triangles
057      on the sphere.
058
059      @param n           number of recursive subdivisions
060      @param hole        do not render one of the four triangles of the tetrahedron
061      @param sierpinski  create Sierpinski triangles
062      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
063   */
064   public SphereSubdivided(final int n, final boolean hole, final boolean sierpinski)
065   {
066      super(String.format("Sphere_Subdivided(%d)", n));
067
068      if (n < 0)
069         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than or equal to 0");
070
071      this.n = n;
072
073      // Start with the tetrahedron's geometry.
074      final double sqr3inv = 1.0/Math.sqrt(3);
075      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( sqr3inv,  sqr3inv,  sqr3inv),
076                   v1 = new Vertex(-sqr3inv,  sqr3inv, -sqr3inv),
077                   v2 = new Vertex( sqr3inv, -sqr3inv, -sqr3inv),
078                   v3 = new Vertex(-sqr3inv, -sqr3inv,  sqr3inv);
079
080      // Subdivide each of the tetrahedron's four triangles.
081      sub(n, v0, v1, v2, sierpinski);
082      sub(n, v1, v3, v2, sierpinski);
083      sub(n, v2, v3, v0, sierpinski);
084      if (! hole) sub(n, v3, v1, v0, sierpinski);
085   }
086
087
088   /**
089      Recursive helper function.
090
091      @param n           number of recursive subdivisions
092      @param v0          vertex of a triangle on the sphere
093      @param v1          vertex of a triangle on the sphere
094      @param v2          vertex of a triangle on the sphere
095      @param sierpinski  create Sierpinski triangles
096   */
097   private void sub(final int n,
098                    final Vertex v0, final Vertex v1, final Vertex v2,
099                    final boolean sierpinski)
100   {
101      assert (n >= 0);
102
103      if (0 == n)
104      {
105         final int index = vertexList.size();
106         addVertex(v0, v1, v2);
107         addPrimitive(new LineStrip(index+0, index+1, index+2, index+0)); // v0, v1, v2
108      }
109      else
110      {
111         // Subdivide each of the three edges.
112         final Vertex v3 = new Vertex(0.5*(v0.x + v1.x),
113                                      0.5*(v0.y + v1.y),
114                                      0.5*(v0.z + v1.z));
115         final Vertex v4 = new Vertex(0.5*(v1.x + v2.x),
116                                      0.5*(v1.y + v2.y),
117                                      0.5*(v1.z + v2.z));
118         final Vertex v5 = new Vertex(0.5*(v2.x + v0.x),
119                                      0.5*(v2.y + v0.y),
120                                      0.5*(v2.z + v0.z));
121         // Normalize the subdivision points.
122         final double L3 = Math.sqrt(v3.x * v3.x + v3.y * v3.y + v3.z * v3.z),
123                      L4 = Math.sqrt(v4.x * v4.x + v4.y * v4.y + v4.z * v4.z),
124                      L5 = Math.sqrt(v5.x * v5.x + v5.y * v5.y + v5.z * v5.z);
125         final Vertex v3n = new Vertex(v3.x / L3, v3.y / L3, v3.z / L3),
126                      v4n = new Vertex(v4.x / L4, v4.y / L4, v4.z / L4),
127                      v5n = new Vertex(v5.x / L5, v5.y / L5, v5.z / L5);
128         // Recursively do another subdivision.
129         sub(n-1, v0,  v3n, v5n, sierpinski);
130         sub(n-1, v5n, v4n, v2,  sierpinski);
131         sub(n-1, v3n, v1,  v4n, sierpinski);
132         if (! sierpinski) sub(n-1, v3n, v4n, v5n, sierpinski);
133      }
134   }
135
136
137
138   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
139   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
140
141   @Override public int getVertCount() {return n;}
142
143   @Override
144   public SphereSubdivided remake(final int n, final int k)
145   {
146      final int newN;
147      if (n != this.n)
148         newN = n;
149      else
150         newN = k;
151      return new SphereSubdivided(newN);
152   }
153}//SphereSubdivided
